title: Fellow Fireside Chat Replay: Getting into the ICS/OT Cybersecurity Field
description:
***Curious about a career in Industrial Control Systems (ICS) and Operational Technology (OT) cybersecurity? Whether you're a student, early-career professional, or someone transitioning from IT or engineering, this Fellow Fireside Chat is designed to give you real-world insights into breaking into and thriving in this critical and rapidly evolving field.***
***Join us for an engaging conversation with seasoned professionals who have successfully navigated their paths into ICS/OT cybersecurity. They'll share personal stories, lessons learned, and practical advice on building relevant skills, networking effectively, and standing out to employers.***

***Expect a candid and inspiring discussion covering:***
***\*How our panelists got started in ICS/OT cybersecurity***
***\*Key skills and certifications that make a difference***
***\*The importance of understanding industrial environments***
***\*Tips for job seekers and career changers***
***\*What makes this field uniquely rewarding (and challenging)***

***Whether you're just starting out or looking to pivot your career, this session is your chance to ask questions, get inspired, and take the next step toward a meaningful career in securing the systems that power our world.***

***Who Should Attend:***
***\*Students and recent graduates***
***\*IT/cybersecurity professionals exploring ICS/OT***
***\*Engineers and technicians looking to shift into cybersecurity***
***\*Anyone interested in protecting critical infrastructure***

***Aired Date: May 21, 2025***

[CLICK HERE TO REGISTER](https://events.zoom.us/ev/AhdhcMOQh040GIklogQIESTQUSQKtNR5v-KryVw6g3xjzWUm5sk7~ApKc-wBe1FSqfjoEQ-naZlSaHiIXWM9SD0ujG_XjpaI2gzcFWeMKwS0a9Jwa3vYxWgHN5YaH8-cwEAuxwAwY0WuKpg)

[https://events.zoom.us/ev/AhdhcMOQh040GIklogQIESTQUSQKtNR5v-KryVw6g3xjzWUm5sk7~ApKc-wBe1FSqfjoEQ-naZlSaHiIXWM9SD0ujG_XjpaI2gzcFWeMKwS0a9Jwa3vYxWgHN5YaH8-cwEAuxwAwY0WuKpg](https://events.zoom.us/ev/AhdhcMOQh040GIklogQIESTQUSQKtNR5v-KryVw6g3xjzWUm5sk7~ApKc-wBe1FSqfjoEQ-naZlSaHiIXWM9SD0ujG_XjpaI2gzcFWeMKwS0a9Jwa3vYxWgHN5YaH8-cwEAuxwAwY0WuKpg)

title: Late Night Coders
description:
Can't sleep? Stay up all night coding? Or can't make the usual meetups till the kids are in bed?

Late Night Coders is a meetup for the rest of us.

Let's get together and share what we're working on, co-work, or get help on any problems we're running into. Some code challenge keeping you up? Bring it to us!

Anyone is welcome at any experience or sleep-deprivation level. Bring your laptop! Or just come hang out with cool people.

Turned off guest options, bring whoever is interested in coming.

title: Post Quantum Cryptography in .NET 10
description:
**Post Quantum Cryptography in .NET 10**
Join us Monday, January 13th, as we dive into the cutting-edge world of post-quantum cryptography and what it means for .NET developers!

**Schedule**

* 5:45 PM — Doors open
* 6:00 PM — Food, drinks, and networking
* 6:30 PM — Presentation begins

**About This Session**
The security and cryptography folks spent the majority of their time in .NET 10's release working on post quantum cryptography. But what is it? In this session we're going to talk about why all of this work was done, what it means for you, and get an idea of what post quantum cryptography is actually for. We'll talk about the emerging problems in the field and how the software industry needs to adapt for the possible future of post quantum computing.

Whether you're deep into security or just curious about where cryptography is headed, this is a session you won't want to miss!

**Location**
Marathon Consulting (2nd Floor)
Plenty of free parking is available behind the building. If you're arriving later, the doors may be locked—check the sign on the door for instructions on how to get in.

**Details**
Food and drinks will be provided. This event is free and open to all skill levels.

title: Seminar: New Era of Defense Cybersecurity: Understanding CMMC 2.0
description:
### (CS)²AI Online™ Seminar

**New Era of Defense Cybersecurity: Understanding CMMC 2.0**
**Sponsored by CambiOS Academy**

The cybersecurity landscape for the Defense Industrial Base (DIB) is rapidly evolving—and **CMMC 2.0** is reshaping how organizations approach compliance, risk management, and cyber resilience.
In this (CS)²AI Online™ Seminar, subject matter experts break down the **intent, structure, and practical implications of CMMC 2.0**, helping organizations move beyond checkbox compliance toward meaningful security outcomes. Attendees will gain clarity on what has changed from previous versions, what requirements apply to their organization, and how to prepare effectively for assessments.

This session is designed for defense contractors, subcontractors, cybersecurity professionals, compliance leaders, and anyone responsible for protecting Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) within the defense ecosystem.

**Key topics include:**

* Overview of CMMC 2.0 and its streamlined model
* Understanding the three maturity levels and assessment requirements
* Alignment with NIST SP 800-171
* Common gaps and challenges organizations face
* Practical steps to prepare for CMMC assessments
* Training and workforce readiness considerations

Whether you’re just beginning your CMMC journey or refining an existing compliance strategy, this seminar provides actionable insights to help you navigate the **new era of defense cybersecurity** with confidence.

*Sponsored by CambiOS Academy*

**[CLICK HERE TO REGISTER FOR THE EVENT](https://events.zoom.us/ev/Aup2XDvRHt6LcH6W9CuFpub1vtw8lQbPXfOC9YR4kclZ9zU9jhnL~Asb1H6aldIH-JC8jzpUSEHkVhDGYkLUpwallQmnPE9q4w2zrnNjunxl9CZucaO7HHJAq38CP1nBamFTAkJ242bT8aA)**

title: WSDG January Technical Presentation
description:
Hexagonal and Screaming Architecture in .NET
by Brandon Atkinson

Abstract:
Hexagonal architecture is an architectural pattern designed to create loosely coupled application components that can seamlessly connect to their software environment using ports and adapters. This approach makes components interchangeable at any level and facilitates test automation, offering a robust alternative to the traditional layered architecture. In hexagonal architecture, each component communicates with others through well-defined "ports," following a specified interface to ensure loose coupling and flexibility.

Screaming architecture, a concept introduced by Robert Martin (Uncle Bob), emphasizes that a software system’s structure should clearly communicate its purpose. Much like a building blueprint reveals the function of a structure, a well-designed software architecture should make its intent immediately apparent.

In this talk, we will briefly explore both hexagonal and screaming architecture patterns, then dive into code to see how these concepts can be applied to a modern .NET codebase. Additionally, we will discuss how these architectural principles can assist in planning and estimating work more effectively.

Bio:
Brandon Atkinson is a software engineer with more than 20 years of experience in the field. He has authored books, been a Microsoft MVP (in SharePoint!), and holds a patent for CI/CD pipelines. He loves tinkering with code, and spends his time with his family in Richmond, VA.
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
This hybrid meeting will be available both in-person and remotely. For those attending in person, we will be at the Williamsburg Regional Library, Conference Room B.
For online access, the Zoom info is:
[https://us06web.zoom.us/j/2562166096?omn=84610009054](https://us06web.zoom.us/j/2562166096?omn=84610009054)
Meeting ID: 256 216 6096

title: Balakumaran Sugumar- Handling Large Scale Banking Data in Microsoft SQL Server
description:
**IN PERSON MEETING!!!!!**
Banking systems handle millions of transactions every day, so databases must be fast, reliable, and accurate. In this session, we’ll look at practical ways to manage large volumes of banking data in Microsoft SQL Server, including table design, indexing, partitioning, and handling concurrent users. You’ll learn how to improve performance, scale transaction workloads, and keep data consistent in real-world SQL Server systems.
group: Hampton Roads SQL Server User Group

title: Hampton Roads DevFest 2026
description:
Mark your calendar for Hampton Roads DevFest 2026! This unique gathering will once again spotlight local speakers, showcasing our community's deep and diverse talent.

Hampton Roads DevFest is more than a conference; it's a tribute to our dynamic local developer community. It's an ideal platform to highlight the exceptional places to work in the Hampton Roads area, emphasizing innovative technological strides. This event caters to everyone in the tech sphere, from seasoned developers and industry veterans to emerging talents and students.

Organized by RevolutionVA, a dedicated 501(c)(3) non-profit, our mission is to advance software development education throughout Virginia. Our passion for promoting learning and growth in technology is at the heart of DevFest.

Take advantage of this unparalleled opportunity to network, learn from top industry professionals, and celebrate the remarkable achievements of our tech community. Whether you're looking to sharpen your skills, explore new career pathways, or simply immerse yourself in a community of like-minded tech enthusiasts, Hampton Roads DevFest is your destination.

Join us as we recognize and nurture the extraordinary tech talent that thrives in Hampton Roads. Let's connect, discover, and grow together at Hampton Roads DevFest 2026!

title: 10 Years A Kotlin Dev
description:
Kotlin has emerged as a compelling choice for both Android and backend development, offering a modern language with strong null-safety, concise syntax, and excellent interoperability with Java. In this meetup, we'll explore the key advantages that drive teams to adopt Kotlin—from improved developer productivity and safer Android apps to structured concurrency with coroutines on the backend. We'll highlight how Kotlin aligns with today's Android ecosystem, integrates with popular backend frameworks, and enables cleaner, more maintainable code across platforms. At the same time, adopting Kotlin is not without challenges. We'll take an honest look at the tradeoffs, including learning curve considerations, build performance, interoperability friction with legacy Java code, and operational concerns in backend systems. Through a retrospective lens, this talk will share practical lessons learned and guidance on when Kotlin is the right choice—and when it may not be—helping attendees make informed decisions for their Android and server-side projects.

This is a Hybrid event, you can also attend virtually using this link: TBA
